qlabel: 1 WELD_aENU_RADIO_10_1 - In the last working week did you carry out any work that may have the risk of higher ionising radiation exposure or did you have to wear a real-time electronic dosimeter? INTERVIEWER: Higher ionising radiation exposure could be due to handling radiation sources or radioactive material including waste products, working near the reactor, emergency intervention.
1A1 WELD_aENU_RADIO_10_1A1 - Did you use radio-protective garments (such as lead aprons, gloves, leaded glasses, whole protection suit) when conducting this work?

1A2 WELD_aENU_RADIO_10_1A2 - In the last working week, did you wear an individual dosimetry badge when handling radioactive sources or radioactive materials including waste, working near the reactor or during an emergency intervention?
1A2A1 WELD_aENU_RADIO_10_1A2A1 - Do you know the dose you had on your badge for the past year?
1A2A1A1 WELD_aENU_RADIO_10_1A2A1A1 - What is the dose you had last year?

categories.catLabel: aENU_1A2A1A1A Less than 2 milisievert per year
aENU_1A2A1A1B Between 2 millisievert and less than 6 millisievert per year
aENU_1A2A1A1C Between 6 and less than 20 millisievert per year
aENU_1A2A1A1D Equal to or more than 20 millisievert per year

qlabel: 1A2A1B1 WELD_aENU_RADIO_10_1A2A1B1 - In the last year, was there an investigation carried out by the national authority due to your individual dosimeter reading?

1A4 WELD_aENU_RADIO_10_1A4 - In the last year, were you a victim of a radiation accident at work?
1A5 WELD_aENU_RADIO_10_1A5 - In the last year, did you attend any workplace training on radiation protection?
